member.name: T:Moonrise.Utils.Test.Logging.TestLogAuditProvider
member.summary: A logging provider that can be utilised when you need to test that certain code DID log or audit something

member.name: T:Moonrise.Utils.Test.Logging.TestLogAuditProvider.LogEntry
member.summary: A log entry captures what was logged

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.Logging.TestLogAuditProvider.LogEntry.Level
member.summary: The logging level used.

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.Logging.TestLogAuditProvider.LogEntry.Message
member.summary: The logging message used

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.Logging.TestLogAuditProvider.LogEntry.LogTag
member.summary: The log tag used

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.Logging.TestLogAuditProvider.LogEntry.Context
member.summary: The context in play

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.Logging.TestLogAuditProvider.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a specified initial size .

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.Logging.TestLogAuditProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and uses a default sizing .

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.Logging.TestLogAuditProvider.LogBuffer
member.summary: A log buffer that you can query later if you need to check things were logged.

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.Logging.TestLogAuditProvider.NextAuditor
member.summary: The next auditor to pass the audit message on to. Allows additional auditors to be used. Don't create circular links though eh!

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.Logging.TestLogAuditProvider.NextLogger
member.summary: The next logger to pass the log message on to. Allows additional loggers to be used. Don't create circular links though eh!

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.Logging.TestLogAuditProvider.AuditThis(System.String,System.String,Moonrise.Logging.LogTag)
member.summary: Audits the message.

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.Logging.TestLogAuditProvider.AuditThisObject(System.String,System.Object,Moonrise.Logging.LoggingLevel,System.String,Moonrise.Logging.LogTag)
member.summary: Audits an object. Can be used IF a specific object is to be audited by an implementation rather than simply a string.

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.Logging.TestLogAuditProvider.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.
member.returns: A new object that is a copy of this instance.

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.Logging.TestLogAuditProvider.LogThis(Moonrise.Logging.LoggingLevel,System.String,Moonrise.Logging.LogTag,System.String)
member.summary: Logs the appropriate level of message.

members.member:
Creates objects filled with data and can also create random data of different types.
NOTE: All the properties that are ...OneShot are properties that are set by an element having an
. The pattern is that the
property applied results in the associated [property]OneShot being set to the value of the attribute. This then controls whether and how that value is created.

member.name: T:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.StringSources
member.summary: "Namespace" (actually a class) for the available string sources

member.name: F:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.StringSources.AlphaNumericCharacters
member.summary: "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ0123456789"

member.summary: "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ0123456789 "

member.name: F:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.StringSources.EverydayCharacters
member.summary: "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ.0123456789:;!\"£$%^&*()-_+={}[]'@#~/?\\€<>"

member.summary: "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"

member.summary: "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz "

member.summary: "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789 "

member.summary: Constant representing the default datetime

member.summary: Constant representing the default datetime offset

member.summary: A map of types and the creators that can create them.

member.summary: Maps implementation types to interfaces that carry s

member.summary: Maps interfaces to implementations to be used when creating elements that are interfaces

member.name: F:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.encounteredObjects
member.summary: A list of object types that have been encountered in a particular context. Used to avoid nesting certain objects.

member.summary: Backing field for MaxObjects

member.name: F:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator._oneShot
member.summary: Backing field for

member.name: F:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator._random
member.summary: The random that will be used by the instance to generate random stuff

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Elements created via this constructor will be non-reliably-repeatable

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Elements created via this constructor will be reliably-repeatable
member.param: The seed to pass to the random generator. Using the same seed and calling in the same creation order will produce repeatable results!

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.AllowNullElementsInEnumerable
member.summary: Determines if nulls are allowed to be inserted into enumerable types - Defaults to false

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.AllowNulls
member.summary: Determines if nulls are allowed for objects and strings - Defaults to false

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.CreationTracer
member.summary: The action to pass the name of the property or field being created - VERY useful for diagnosing recursive creation failures!

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.IgnoredIssueTracer
member.summary: The action to pass the string of a problem that has been set to ignore - VERY useful for diagnosing expected creations with null elements!

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.IgnoreNonDefaultConstructors
member.summary: Any class requiring a non-default constructor will be ignored and returned as null - defaults to true.

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.IgnoreRecursion
member.summary: Detects and ignores recursion - defaults to true.

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.IgnoreSetterExceptions
member.summary: Ignores exceptions that occur when a value is assigned to a property or field, leaving it as null - defaults to true.

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.IgnoreUnimplementedInterfaces
member.summary: If an interface does not have a defined implemented indicated via or then setting this to true will allow that element to be null, despite the setting of - defaults to true.

member.summary: The maximum byte value to use in following creation/random calls

member.summary: The maximum char value to use in following creation/random calls

member.summary: The maximum decimal value to use in following creation/random calls

member.summary: The maximum double value to use in following creation/random calls

member.summary: The maximum integer value to use in following creation/random calls

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.MaxItems
member.summary: Maximum number of items to add to an IEnumerable member. Defaults to 4.

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.MaxLong
member.summary: The maximum long value to use in following creation/random calls

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.MaxObjects
member.summary: The maximum number of objects that will be created in one hit. Defaults to 100,000. This WILL overrule all other properties so you MAY get null objects despite properties specified elsewhere! You cannot set this value higher than .
member.exception: If you try to set MaxObjects too high, I won't let you!

member.summary:
Determines if the filling should respect any validation attributes on the elements being filled and only fill with data that meets the validation constraints. At the moment, only the following are respected;
NOTE: Validation requirements will overule any s that cover the same territory!

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.CreateFilled``1(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an object of type T whose public fields and properties are filled with random(ish) values.
member.param: The seed to apply for this creation. If left at default of then the random generator will not be re-seeded
Determines if nested classes will be filled as well. Usually want this.

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.CreateFilled``2(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an object of type T whose public fields and properties are filled with random(ish) values but can use interface I to control the creation.
member.typeparam: An interface that can be used to control object creation via . The interface effectively implements the class, i.e. same property/field names are found in order to get the attributes applied, if any.
member.param: The seed to apply for this creation. If left at default of then the random generator will not be re-seeded
Determines if nested classes will be filled as well. Usually want this.

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.CreateFilled(System.Type,System.Type,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an object of type T whose public fields and properties are filled with random(ish) values but can use interface I to control the creation.
member.param: An interface that can be used to control object creation via . The interface effectively implements the class, i.e. same property/field names are found in order to get the attributes applied, if any.
The seed to apply for this creation. If left at default of then the random generator will not be re-seeded

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator.GetRandomBool(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets a random boolean.
member.param: The threshold above which to return true - set lower for more trues.
member.returns: true or false - guess which one!

member.name: T:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.ObjectCreationAttribute.SIItemSource`1
member.summary: This "static" interface (which you can't have) is to illustrate the expected static method your ItemSource static class should expose in order to act as in ItemSource OR it must expose the element name as a property !
member.typeparam: Just to illustrate that each of the properties need to return the appropriate type for that element.

member.name: P:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.ObjectCreationAttribute.SIItemSource`1.ElementName
member.summary: Gets the list of objects to be used as the item source for . IF the ItemsSource attribute DOES supply a static method then it will be called in preference to the property, unless your implements the static property , in which case it will use that to decide whether to use the property OR the static method to supply the source list.

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.ObjectCreationAttribute.SIItemSource`1.ItemSource(System.String,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,System.Reflection.FieldInfo,Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.Creator)
member.summary: Returns the list of objects to be used as the item source for elementName
member.param: The property information - Only if it's a property, null otherwise.
The field information - Only if it's a field, null otherwise.
The instance to use to help you create a random instance, if you need to.
member.returns: List of objects, to be used to randomly choose from to fill the property or field that the attribute has been applied to

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.ObjectCreation.ObjectCreationAttribute.SIItemSource`1.PreferPropertyToItemSourceCall(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the or the is to be used as the source for elements for the elementName />.
member.returns: True means use the static property where it exists, False means use the static method.

members.member:
Allows access to private methods of a "wrapped object"
Usage: dynamic wrapper = PrivateWrapper.Create{ClassWithPrivateMethods}(constructor args) wrapper.PrivateMethod();
based on but tweaked from http://www.amazedsaint.com/2010/05/accessprivatewrapper-c-40-dynamic.html
You will also need to add a reference to System.ServiceModel!

member.name: F:Moonrise.Utils.Test.PrivateWrapper.Flags
member.summary: Specify the flags for accessing members

member.name: F:Moonrise.Utils.Test.PrivateWrapper._wrapped
member.summary: The object we are going to wrap

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.PrivateWrapper.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Create a simple private wrapper

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.PrivateWrapper.Create``1(System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a wrapped object whose private methods and properties can be accessed.
member.param: Any parameters to pass to the constructor

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.PrivateWrapper.FromType(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a dynamic object from the named type in an identified assembly
member.param: Any parameters to pass to its constructor

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.PrivateWrapper.TryGetMember(System.Dynamic.GetMemberBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Tries to get a property or field with the given name
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member on which the dynamic operation is performed. For example, for the Console.WriteLine(sampleObject.SampleProperty) statement, where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The result of the get operation. For example, if the method is called for a property, you can assign the property value to .
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behaviour. (In most cases, a run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.PrivateWrapper.TryInvokeMember(System.Dynamic.InvokeMemberBinder,System.Object[],System.Object@)
member.summary: Try invoking a method
member.param: Provides information about the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member on which the dynamic operation is performed. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleMethod(100), where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleMethod". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.

The arguments that are passed to the object member during the invoke operation. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleMethod(100), where sampleObject is derived from the class, args[0] is equal to 100.
The result of the member invocation.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behaviour. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: M:Moonrise.Utils.Test.PrivateWrapper.TrySetMember(System.Dynamic.SetMemberBinder,System.Object)
member.summary: Tries to set a property or field with the given name
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member to which the value is being assigned. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The value to set to the member. For example, for sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, the is "Test".
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behaviour. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)
